items.longDescription:
Doraemon is depicted in this original artwork inspired by Johannes Vermeer's painting “Astronomer”.

Doraemon meets the Louvre

Doraemon, Japan’s popular character created by Fujiko・F・Fujio, and his friends visits the Louvre, enjoying its art and even stepping into the world of its masterpieces. Enjoy this unique UT collection, where you can journey with Doraemon and his friends through the timeless and radiant world of art that continues to shine across space and time.

Inspired by: The Astronomer / Johannes VERMEER
© Fujiko-Pro, Shogakukan, TV-Asahi, Shin-ei, and ADK
items.name: Doraemon meets the Louvre UT (Short Sleeve T-Shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.longDescription:
Disney’s Mickey Faces

Drawing and designing Disney’s Mickey Mouse has been passed down through generations of Disney artists. Enjoy this collection detailing Mickey Mouse, with designs created in collaboration with Disney artists from around the globe, now available at UNIQLO.

©Disney

items.longDescription:
Museum of Fine Arts Boston Ukiyo-e

The design features representative works by three famous Ukiyo-e artists (Kuniyoshi Utagawa, Hiroshige Utagawa, and Hokusai Katsushika).
items.name: Museum of Fine Arts Boston Ukiyo-e UT (Graphic T-shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.freeInformation: - The images shown may include colors that are not available.
items.longDescription:
NY POP ART

UT has long partnered with pop art pioneers, including Andy Warhol, Keith Haring, and Jean-Michel Basquiat. These legendary artists have left behind various works that make art more accessible and enjoyable for people. Experience the joy of wearing pop art that is loved across generations.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,” with abstract marks and patterning.

© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
items.name: NY POP ART Archive UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.longDescription:
This t-shirt features an original illustration of Doraemon and Nobita appreciating The Portrait of Lisa Gherardini, known widely as the Mona Lisa.

Doraemon meets the Louvre

Doraemon, Japan’s popular character created by Fujiko・F・Fujio, and his friends visits the Louvre, enjoying its art and even stepping into the world of its masterpieces. Enjoy this unique UT collection, where you can journey with Doraemon and his friends through the timeless and radiant world of art that continues to shine across space and time.

Mona Lisa – Portrait of Lisa Gherardini, wife of Francesco del Giocondo / Leonardo DA VINCI
© 2007 Musée du Louvre, Dist. GrandPalaisRmn / Angèle Dequier
© Fujiko-Pro, Shogakukan, TV-Asahi, Shin-ei, and ADK

items.longDescription:
UTGP2025 x TATE MODERN

The UT Grand Prix (UTGP) is an annual global design competition that celebrates the T-shirt as a canvas for creative expression. This year, in partnership with Tate Modern, which is celebrating its 25th birthday, we've invited designs from around the world under the theme "Create the Future: Be Inspired by Play." Find the perfect T-shirt that will inspire your future."

©Tate 2025

Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba

Based on the manga by Koyoharu Gotoge and animated by studio ufotable, "Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba” is now featured in a new collection featuring iconic illustrations from the TV anime. Enjoy the worldview depicted with a unique touch. The newest movie, “Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba The Movie: Infinity Castle” will finally be released in 2025.

©Koyoharu Gotoge / SHUEISHA, Aniplex, ufotable

UT ARCHIVE ONE PIECE

“UT Archive" is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. This time, T-shirts from the TV anime “ONE PIECE”, which began broadcasting in 1999 is re-released from the anime UT collection that have been released in the past and have been a big hit.

items.longDescription:
Disney’s Mickey Faces

Drawing and designing Disney’s Mickey Mouse has been passed down through generations of Disney artists. Enjoy this collection detailing Mickey Mouse, with designs created in collaboration with Disney artists from around the globe, now available at UNIQLO.

©Disney

items.longDescription:
UTGP2025 x TATE MODERN

The UT Grand Prix (UTGP) is an annual global design competition that celebrates the T-shirt as a canvas for creative expression. This year, in partnership with Tate Modern, which is celebrating its 25th birthday, we've invited designs from around the world under the theme "Create the Future: Be Inspired by Play." Find the perfect T-shirt that will inspire your future."

©Tate 2025
items.name: UTGP2025 x TATE MODERN UT (Graphic T-Shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.longDescription:
Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba

Based on the manga by Koyoharu Gotoge and animated by studio ufotable, "Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba” is now featured in a new collection featuring iconic illustrations from the TV anime. Enjoy the worldview depicted with a unique touch. The newest movie, “Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba The Movie: Infinity Castle” will finally be released in 2025.

©Koyoharu Gotoge / SHUEISHA, Aniplex, ufotable

items.longDescription:
Pokémon

Pikachu and other Pokémon friends have once again gathered for UT. This collection features delightful sketch style designs which capture both leisurely and energetic scenes, along with adorable phrases that perfectly represent each Pokémon. You'll surely find a style just your type.

©2025 Pokémon.
©1995-2025 Nintendo/Creatures Inc./GAME FREAK inc.
